alert.note: Alert for Logan; Morgan; Sedgwick; Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 23 at 9:34PM MDT until June 24 at 12:30AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Logan County in northeastern Colorado... Northeastern Morgan County in northeastern Colorado... Northwestern Sedgwick County in northeastern Colorado... East Central Weld County in northeastern Colorado... * Until 1230 AM MDT. * At 934 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sterling, Merino, Iliff, Peetz, Crook, Logan Corners, North Sterling Reservoir, Pawnee Pass, Atwood, Willard, Padroni, Stoneham, Proctor, Antelope Springs, New Raymer, Twin Buttes and Buckingham. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Excessive runoff from this storm will cause flash flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland along creeks, and other low lying areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
